cycloneMessage.systemGeoRefPt1: ABOUT 1345 MI...2165 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII

cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM
BULLETIN Tropical Storm Greg Advisory Number 32 NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL EP072017 200 AM PDT Tue Jul 25 2017
...GREG EXPECTED TO WEAKEN OVER THE NEXT DAY OR TWO...
SUMMARY OF 200 AM PDT...0900 UTC...INFORMATION ---------------------------------------------- LOCATION...15.2N 135.7W ABOUT 1345 MI...2165 KM E OF SOUTH POINT HAWAII ABOUT 1765 MI...2835 KM WSW OF THE SOUTHERN TIP OF BAJA CALIFORNIA MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...45 MPH...75 KM/H PRESENT MOVEMENT...WNW OR 295 DEGREES AT 9 MPH...15 KM/H MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES
WATCHES AND WARNINGS -------------------- There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.
DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK ------------------------------ At 200 AM PDT (0900 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Greg was located near latitude 15.2 North, longitude 135.7 West. Greg is moving toward the west-northwest near 9 mph (15 km/h). A turn toward the northwest is expected later today, followed by a gradual turn toward the west by Wednesday night.
Maximum sustained winds are near 45 mph (75 km/h) with higher gusts. Some weakening is forecast during the next 48 hours, and Greg is expected to become a tropical depression on Wednesday.
Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 70 miles (110 km) from the center.
The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).
HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND ---------------------- None.
NEXT ADVISORY ------------- Next complete advisory at 800 AM PDT.
$$ Forecaster Beven
NNNN
